description.narrative: The network will support greater recognition and social sensitivity to the environmental and social impacts of major development projects initiated by companies and the state, particularly through the voices of affected communities. These developments include forest projects, biofuels, dams and water diversions, pesticides, banana plantations, and possibly transgenic seeds, among others, and their resulting wastes are allowed to build up or are discharged into waterways. Consequently, this affects rural and campesino territories and often disrupts rural farmes' livelihoods and leads to their displacement. The network will promote dialogue with communities in Manabi and Los Rios to identify impacting projects in their territories and propose alternatives that protect food sovereignty, water, and human rights. It will develop material on issues and socio environmental conflicts to gain greater local, national, and regional recognition of the impacts.
